intro: Coffea bakossii, commonly known as the Bakossi coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Cameroon and grows in the mountainous regions of the country. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It is known for its unique flavor profile and is considered a rare variety. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to both botanists and coffee enthusiasts.
